entry.title: 21-year-old Roseburg man charged with attempted murder after assault on elderly victim
entry.summary: A 21-year-old Roseburg man is facing attempted murder charges after detectives say he broke into a Myrtle Creek home and assaulted 73-year-old Stephen Balliew. The victim’s injuries did not match a reported fall, prompting a full investigation.

entry.title: Peggy Konzack, 104, retires from teaching swim lessons
entry.summary: It’s the ending of an age for the YMCA of Douglas County. After 57 years, Peggy Konzack has retired from teaching swim lessons.

entry.title: Cow Creek Tribe donates $130,050 in student meal funds to Douglas County school districts
entry.summary: For impoverished families, the holidays can be a challenge as seasonal obligations can pile stress onto regular struggles. But for families with students in Douglas County, things may be a little easier this season.

entry.title: Douglas County fire departments conduct joint live fire training exercise in Roseburg
entry.summary: The smoke was visible as far as Winston, rising into the sky in a massive black cloud. At the scene, a crowd had gathered to watch, the heat radiating across the street as the building burned to the ground.

entry.title: Sutherlin begins search for new superintendent
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Terry Prestianni, Sutherlin School District superintendent, plans to retire at the end of the 2025-26 school year.

entry.title: HOYLE VOTES IN FAVOR OF RELEASING EPSTEIN FILES
entry.summary: November 19, 2025 4:00 a.m. On Tuesday, Congresswoman Val Hoyle voted to force the public release of any information that the Department of Justice has on Jeffrey Epstein and their investigation into his sex trafficking crimes. The bill also requires measures be taken to prevent the exposure of victim’s information during release. After the vote,...

entry.title: UMPQUA VALLEY FOOD RALLY HAPPENING THURSDAY
entry.summary: November 19, 2025 3:05 a.m. With the holiday season almost here, and local food pantries experiencing record demand following the recent federal government shutdown, Aviva Health, the United Community Action Network and FISH Food Pantry are partnering to host the Umpqua Valley Food Rally on Thursday. It will take place from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00...

entry.title: High-Speed Chase Through Gaddis Park Ends in Arrest of Roseburg Man
entry.summary: A late-night chase through Gaddis Park ended with the arrest of 49-year-old Joshua Frazier after police say he fled on a dirt bike and later crashed near the I-5 walking bridge. Officers found meth in his possession and confirmed he had an outstanding warrant.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN CHRISTMAS TREE LIGHTING ON NOVEMBER 30TH
entry.summary: November 18, 2025 3:30 p.m. The Sutherlin annual Christmas Tree lighting will take place on Sunday, November 30th beginning at 5:00 p.m. in Central Park. The event is scheduled earlier than in the past, but organizers say that will allow for the tree lights to brighten the downtown area throughout the month of December.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.18.25
entry.summary: State Representative Ed Diehl is leading the petition effort to stop four provisions in the recently approved transportation package. He talked about the signature gathering effort and the wide support he is seeing from around the state.

entry.title: Ingram Content Group Expanding Hiring in Roseburg, Hosts Local Job Fair Nov. 19
entry.summary: Ingram Content Group is expanding its Roseburg workforce and hosting a job fair on Nov. 19 from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Nearly 60 positions are opening as the facility prepares for major growth in 2026. Applicants can learn more at ingramcareers.com.

entry.title: New Traffic Signal at Highway 42 and Rolling Hills Road Expected to Go Live This Week
entry.summary: ODOT plans to activate the new Oregon 42 traffic signal at Rolling Hills Road by Wednesday night. Lane closures continue as crews finish installation. The signal is part of an $11.97M safety and paving project, with more median improvements coming in the weeks ahead.

entry.summary: You may walk in looking to just ship a package or rent a mailbox. You may walk out with a PlayStation 3, a Luke Skywalker action figure, a bag of beef jerky and a Wheaties box signed by Jerry Rice.

entry.title: Lease Purchase and Project Listings Hint at Tractor Supply Plans in Roseburg
entry.summary: Online records show Tractor Supply purchased the former Big Lots lease on NE Stephens in Roseburg as part of an 18-store deal nationwide. Construction listings now reference a Roseburg renovation, but the company has not yet announced an opening date.
